intro: Pselium heterophyllum, commonly known as the slender pselium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native habitat's flora.
